content: the air in this cave is damp and heavy you feel as though you may drown if you
breathe too deeply as you walk old bones crunch beneath your feet from the
shadows you hear skittering and suddenly massive spiders large enough to pull a
cart jump from their hiding-places as they stand on their hind legs they tower
over you their massive jaws chatter and drip with putrid liquid could it be
venom it likely doesn't matter as one bite from these beasts could surely
remove your head entirely hey guys welcome back to another episode of black
magic crafts on this week's episode I'm not tackling a big build or anything
like that I'm gonna show you how I worked through a particular problem that
I encountered this past week I bought some minis I bought some spider
miniatures I opened them up and I was just gonna quickly throw them on a base
and paint them up and I figured it would be a really easy and fast mini paint to
add to my collection but when I open them up I realized that
these things out of the package didn't really have an easy or good way to
attach them to the base they didn't come with a pre sculpted pudding base like
I've talked about previously they didn't have any sort of stand or anything there
was no way to attach these straight of the package onto the base which was a
little bit frustrating it wasn't too big of a deal because I knew how to deal
with this fairly easily I knew I could just pin the model and sculpt a custom
base thinking about the fact that these particular minis are sold as kind of
beginner level miniatures that are supposed to be good to go out of the
package I knew that some people if they open
these up could find it incredibly frustrating because I had to fix this
problem for myself I figured I would document the process and share it with
you guys this covers how to deal with this particular situation but it will
also show you how to sculpt an original mini
a hundred percent from scratch very very quickly and easily it's really not that
hard let's take a look so opening this thing up I was met with three spiders
none of which really were sculpted in a way that was conducive to putting them
on a round base these whiz kids meanies come with these in plastic bases I don't
like to use them I prefer the thicker repr ones either way these spiders just
wouldn't sit on these nicely the weird thing is that these came with two sort
of separate base things one that was kind of just like a muddy sculpt and one
that was sort of wrapped up people in webs which were pretty cool but why do
three spiders come with two decorative pieces why aren't there three of them
neither of them made basing these any easier so I don't really quite
understand the thought process here either way the one of wrapped up people
I'm gonna put aside and it's gonna be a great little bit of scatter terrain that
I will use later in order to get these things on a base and posed in a good
fashion I knew that I needed to pin them I took a rotary tool you can use a
dremel whatever and the a very small drill bit drill a hole right in the
thickest part of the underside of the mini and then just superglue in a paper
clip now this will do two things it will one let you hold the awkward mini while
painting because you want to paint this thing up fully before putting it on the
base then once your mini is painted and your basis sculpted this pin will be an
anchoring point to join the two together I did a simple paint job on the spiders
and put them aside so that I could get to work sculpting the bases and for this
I used regular milliput which I find easier to work with in cases like this
then using green stuff just mix the two parts together and start spreading it
across the entire surface of the round base I wanted some elevation on these
bases some objects that these spiders could be crawling over so that I could
and had something to pin them to so I left a larger amount of milliput in the
Centers of the bases and then using a sculpting tool I just sculpted the
centers into rocks this is really easy you basically just take a flat sculpting
tool and push it down until you have what looks like a stone projecting from
the earth there's really no complicated artistic skills here these bases in
total for all three probably took me five minutes to sculpt once the bases
were sculpted it was important that before the Mille putt cured I posed the
spiders and create the pinhole for them to glue into later so I cut the pins
shorter on the spiders and placed them how I would like indented the paperclip
into the base so this way there would be a perfect receiving hole for the pin
when I was finished and gluing them together at this point it was important
to keep the bases matched with the spiders because these spiders all had
slightly different poses and they created some indents in the mill of hut
so I wanted to make sure that I kept track of which spider went with which
base for the rest of the process once the millipede is cured it is rock
hard and these will be indestructible bases it's important to clean up the
edges a little bit because they can get a little bit messy while sculpting so
you're gonna scrape that off before painting I've used many different
primers on milliput and I've even painted it directly with acrylic paint
and honestly I've never encountered any problems with any of them so you can
probably get away with using whatever you want I choose to use the Vallejo
surface primer it's an airbrush primer but I just use it with a brush and it
seems to work really really well for me after the primer is dried I gave these
bases a very simple paint job basically paint the dirt brown and the stones kind
of beige and then I gave them a wash with an egg rocks earth shade any dark
brown or kind of blackish-brown wash will do just fine
once they were dry the fun part could begin and that was actually attaching
these spiders to their new custom bases and because the hole was in place and
the pin was already in place this couldn't get any easier just needed a
little bit of superglue on the pin and where any solid part of the mini might
be touching the base boom put some glue on put them together done
